intro: Cistus × ledon nothosubsp. atlantis, commonly known as the Atlantic cistus, is a hybrid shrub native to the western Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its aromatic leaves and flowers have been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. This subspecies is notable for its resilience and ability to flourish in harsh, coastal environments.
